intro: Rauvolfia striata, commonly known as Indian snakeroot, is a climbing shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its roots are the primary source of the alkaloid reserpine, which has been used in traditional medicine and modern pharmacology. Rauvolfia striata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along streambanks.
